title: Narrator and Jordan discuss driving
text:

and looked around for Gatsby. It was testimony to the romantic
speculation he inspired that there were whispers about him from those
who had found little that it was necessary to whisper about in this
world.

The first supper—there would be another one after midnight—was now
being served, and Jordan invited me to join her own party, who were
spread around a table on the other side of the garden. There were
three married couples and Jordan’s escort, a

relations.explanation: The girls leaning together confidentially and sharing rumors about Gatsby killing a man suggests a close, gossipy relationship. The phrase "Somebody told me they thought he killed a man once" indicates a shared interest in scandalous rumors about Gatsby.

The girls leaning together confidentially and sharing rumors about Gatsby killing a man suggests a close, gossipy relationship. The phrase "Somebody told me they thought he killed a man once" indicates a shared interest in scandalous rumors about Gatsby.

The three Mr. Mumbles bent forward and listened eagerly to the rumors about Gatsby. This indicates they are interested in gossip about Gatsby.

The girls are spreading rumors about Gatsby, suggesting a negative perception of him. The phrase "It’s more that he was a German spy during the war" and "I'll bet he killed a man" indicates a negative rumor.

The girls are spreading rumors about Gatsby, suggesting a negative perception of him. The phrase "It’s more that he was a German spy during the war" and "I'll bet he killed a man" indicates a negative rumor.

The Mr. Mumbles are listening to rumors about Gatsby, suggesting a negative perception of him. The phrase "I heard that from a man who knew all about him, grew up with him in Germany," he assured us positively indicates a negative rumor.
Jordan invited the narrator to join her party. This suggests a friendly relationship.
